text: Has anyone seen this before? Can’t add a module to my blog post template, even though it is set to be available in pages and blogs.
figured it out, this was unchecked for some reason:

I've also found that sometimes, even if that is checked...you still have to make a change (like add a space somewhere and remove it), and hit Publish again. Then it'll be available for sure. :slightly_smiling_face:
Oh strange. Not sure what the purpose of that button would be. Tooltip isn’t super helpful:
oh man I forgot it said that yesterday :joy:

Eek! Lemme fix that tooltip text. And yeah the purpose of the toggle is that if you no longer want the module added to templates you can toggle it off (soon it'll also prevent the module from being added to pages or in the content editors but we had to fix some stuff around that first). We use that feature for when you clone modules that may have publish-blocking validation errors, so that way you cannot add it to a template or publish it until you fix the errors.
That second screenshot with the messed up text from Pete is in the blog template editor, that makes the template not available to be used for blogs
But what I said before still goes for modules :slightly_smiling_face:
Hello everyone!!! Does anyone know what´s the Google Chrome extension for HubSpot Cache?  I can´t find it yet. :disappointed:
you can also check out <#CCQ7H31D5|developer-tools> for other cool tools
